body:
Hi,
I was trying to get spack going on another system and have run into this abort.
I just downloaded a fresh copy of the devel branch of spack from 
[jeg@localhost packages]$ git remote -v
origin	https://github.com/spack/spack.git (fetch)
origin	https://github.com/spack/spack.git (push)
upstream	https://github.com/spack/spack.git (fetch)
upstream	https://github.com/spack/spack.git (push)

[jeg@localhost packages]$ spack find
==> 0 installed packages.

[jeg@localhost packages]$ spack compilers
==> Available compilers
Process Process-3:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 258, in _bootstrap
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 114, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/home/jeg/jgalarowicz_spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/multiproc.py", line 37, in fun
    pipe.send(f(x))
  File "/home/jeg/jgalarowicz_spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py", line 285, in <lambda>
    self.find_compiler(cmp_cls, *filtered_path),
  File "/home/jeg/jgalarowicz_spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py", line 324, in find_compiler
    spec = spack.spec.CompilerSpec(cmp_cls.name, ver)
  File "/home/jeg/jgalarowicz_spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 459, in __init__
    self.versions.add(ver(version))
  File "/home/jeg/jgalarowicz_spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/version.py", line 870, in ver
    return _string_to_version(obj)
  File "/home/jeg/jgalarowicz_spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/version.py", line 860, in _string_to_version
    return Version(string)
  File "/home/jeg/jgalarowicz_spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/version.py", line 117, in __init__
    raise ValueError("Bad characters in version string: %s" % string)
ValueError: Bad characters in version string: 
^C
==> Error: Keyboard interrupt.


[jeg@localhost packages]$ which gcc
/usr/bin/gcc


[jeg@localhost packages]$ gcc -v
Using built-in specs.
COLLECT_GCC=gcc
COLLECT_LTO_WRAPPER=/usr/libexec/gcc/x86_64-redhat-linux/7/lto-wrapper
OFFLOAD_TARGET_NAMES=nvptx-none
OFFLOAD_TARGET_DEFAULT=1
Target: x86_64-redhat-linux
Configured with: ../configure --enable-bootstrap --enable-languages=c,c++,objc,obj-c++,fortran,ada,go,lto --prefix=/usr --mandir=/usr/share/man --infodir=/usr/share/info --with-bugurl=http://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla --enable-shared --enable-threads=posix --enable-checking=release --enable-multilib --with-system-zlib --enable-__cxa_atexit --disable-libunwind-exceptions --enable-gnu-unique-object --enable-linker-build-id --with-gcc-major-version-only --with-linker-hash-style=gnu --enable-plugin --enable-initfini-array --with-isl --enable-libmpx --enable-offload-targets=nvptx-none --without-cuda-driver --enable-gnu-indirect-function --with-tune=generic --with-arch_32=i686 --build=x86_64-redhat-linux
Thread model: posix
gcc version 7.2.1 20170915 (Red Hat 7.2.1-2) (GCC) 


[jeg@localhost packages]$ gcc --version
gcc (GCC) 7.2.1 20170915 (Red Hat 7.2.1-2)
Copyright (C) 2017 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

[jeg@localhost packages]$
title: "spack compilers" abort - fedora26 gcc-7.2.1-2 compiler present
